definition: to attack/to inherit/classifier for suits (esp. of funeral robes)

sentences.english: She said she encountered one of the attackers a day before the incident.
sentences.chinese: 她说她在遇袭前一天曾经遇见过其中一个施暴者。

sentences.english: No one has been charged in Beketov's case.
sentences.chinese: 在别克托夫的遇袭案中，没有人受到指控。

sentences.english: The Italian prime minister was whisked away in a car after falling to the ground during the attack.
sentences.chinese: 这位意大利总理在遇袭倒地后被轿车带走了。

sentences.english: How do you see the assault event of FangZhouzi?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么看待方舟子遇袭事件吗？

sentences.english: Satellite trucks were attacked and set on fire.
sentences.chinese: 卫星卡车遇袭并被纵火。

sentences.english: Have you spoken in detail about your case to anyone?
sentences.chinese: 你曾对别人讲过你遇袭的细节吗？

sentences.english: Okay. Here's a harder one. When was Peal Harbor attacked?
sentences.chinese: 好的。再来个难一点的。珍珠港什么时候遇袭的？

sentences.english: The victim was outside a shop when he was attacked.
sentences.chinese: 被害人遇袭时正在一家商店的外面。

sentences.english: He said he was lightly wounded in the attack on his compound, adding that seven people had been killed.
sentences.chinese: 他说，他在总统府遇袭时受轻伤，另外有七人遇难。

sentences.english: However, never depend on any self-defence tool to stop an attacker.
sentences.chinese: 但也要记得，遇袭时不能完全依赖任何自卫工具。

definition: to be attacked by an assassin
to get into difficulties/to meet with danger
to assassinate/(military) to fight with a bayonet/(baseball) to put out (a baserunner)
to kidnap/to hijack/to abduct/to hold under duress
to shoot with a gun/shooting incident
to come to the aid of/to save/to rescue from danger/to relieve
to mount a sneak attack/to raid
